item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, March 11, 2025 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Happy 20th Birthday, Y Combinator (754 points | 143 comments)
2. Fastplotlib: GPU-accelerated, fast, and interactive plotting library (287 points | 112 comments)
3. New tools for building agents (223 points | 69 comments)
4. Show HN: Factorio Learning Environment – Agents Build Factories (578 points | 174 comments)
5. NASA to launch space observatory that will map 450M galaxies (129 points | 53 comments)

7. The US island that speaks Elizabethan English (173 points | 91 comments)
8. A 10x Faster TypeScript (1266 points | 579 comments)
9. Show HN: Krep a High-Performance String Search Utility Written in C (116 points | 42 comments)
10. Continue (YC S23) Is Hiring a Software Engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
11. The Startup CTO's Handbook (8 points | 1 comment)
12. In contrast to Earth, Mars's middle atmosphere appears driven by gravity waves (24 points | 7 comments)
13. Show HN: We built a Plug-in Home Battery for the 99.7% of us without Powerwalls (92 points | 114 comments)
14. Mapping the University of Chicago's 135-year expansion into Hyde Park and beyond (177 points | 54 comments)
15. Backyard Cyanide (87 points | 32 comments)

18. Smart researchers pioneer nanosensor for real-time iron detection in plants (12 points | 1 comment)
19. What makes code hard to read: Visual patterns of complexity (2023) (251 points | 244 comments)
20. Show HN: Program Explorer, a container playground (47 points | 7 comments)

22. How do we tell truths that might hurt? (1975) (22 points | 24 comments)
23. America Is Missing The New Labor Economy – Robotics Part 1 (132 points | 178 comments)
24. Percolation Theory [pdf] (32 points | 9 comments)
25. Show HN: Seven39, a social media app that is only open for 3 hours every evening (667 points | 313 comments)
26. India's Battle to Control the Democracy Narrative (4 points | discuss)
27. Snapshots of Modern Mathematics from Oberwolfach (23 points | 2 comments)
28. Short Conversations with Poets: Dong Li (36 points | 4 comments)
29. Representing Type Lattices Compactly (75 points | 21 comments)
